{"id":938211403,"lang":"cpp","lang_name":"C++","time":"5Â months","timestamp":1682220932,"status":11,"status_display":"Wrong Answer","runtime":"N/A","url":"/submissions/detail/938211403/","is_pending":"Not Pending","title":"Sliding Subarray Beauty","memory":"N/A","code":"class Solution {\npublic:\n    vector<int> getSubarrayBeauty(vector<int>& nums, int k, int x) {\n    int n = nums.size();\n    vector<int> beauty;\n    int numNegatives = 0; // Number of negative integers in the current subarray\n    priority_queue<int> maxHeap; // Max heap to keep track of the k largest negative integers\n    \n    for (int i = 0; i < n; i++) {\n        if (i >= k) {\n            // Remove the element that goes out of the sliding window\n            int prev = nums[i - k];\n            if (prev <= 0) {\n                numNegatives--;\n                maxHeap.push(prev);\n            }\n        }\n        // Add the new element in the sliding window\n        if (nums[i] <= 0) {\n            numNegatives++;\n            maxHeap.push(nums[i]);\n        }\n        \n        if (i >= k - 1) {\n            // Get the beauty of the subarray\n            if (numNegatives >= x) {\n                // If there are at least x negative integers, take the xth smallest negative integer\n                while (maxHeap.size() > k - x) {\n                    maxHeap.pop();\n                }\n                beauty.push_back(maxHeap.top());\n            } else {\n                // If there are less than x negative integers, the beauty is 0\n                beauty.push_back(0);\n            }\n        }\n    }\n    return beauty;\n}\n\n};\n\n","compare_result":"","title_slug":"sliding-subarray-beauty","has_notes":false,"flag_type":1}
